record.attribute: ToxoDB is a genome database for the genus Toxoplasma, a set of single-celled eukaryotic pathogens that cause human and animal diseases, including toxoplasmosis.

• Toxoplasma gondii (ME49, RH, GT1, Veg strains)
  • Neospora caninum
  • environmental isolate sequences from numerous species

• The EuPathDB Data Summary provides an overview of the content in Eu PathDB across sites, all organisms and data types covered.
  • The EuPathDB Gene Metrics Table summarizes the number of genes for the o rganisms currently available in EuPathDB, by various datatypes.

There are several kinds of downloads available in a EuPathDB site:
  • Download files that we create at release time. The link to access these files is under the menu item "Downloads", under "Data Files". These include fasta files for all available sequences, gff files with complete gene information, and other formats.
  • Download files with results generated by running queries. From a result page (after running a query) a user can access the "Download Resuts" link, to a new page where a few different options are offered. The goal is to construct a file for download that include all IDs in the result; the user requests a file format and, in some formats, the user may request additional information about the result IDs.
  • Download files that have been uploaded by the community in our websites, available under "Downloads" or "Community".
  • Download EuPathDB publications, under the menu item "Donwloads".

ToxoDB is a member of pathogen-databases that are housed under the NIAID-funded EuPathDB Bioinformatics Resource Center (BRC) umbrella. The EuPathDB team is mainly distributed between the University of Pennsylvania in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania and the University of Georgia in Athens, Georgia.

The data at this site is provided freely for public use, through the contributions of many researchers including those involved in generating the genome sequences. The data is not guaranteed to be accurate as it often reflects the results of ongoing research. When using data obtained from ToxoDB, it is important to cite the original publications and contributors of that data and ToxoDB. Please see Citing ToxoDB below.

When citing ToxoDB itself, please use:

Much of the data in ToxoDB is provided by independent researchers. Please cite them if you use their data. For a list of the data integrated into ToxoDB and the related publications please see Data Sources.

Naming Convention
The primary T. gondii sequence and annotation contained in ToxoDB has come from TIGR. We have retained the orignal name to enable users to trace sequences found in ToxoDB back to the original source.
  • Scaffolds have the following pattern:
    • TGG_dddddd
      where d stands for a digit. e.g., TGG_995305.
       
  • Gene Names have the following pattern:
    • dd.mdddd
      where d stands for a digit. e.g., 55.m0520.
